summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from August 2019 discussing a follow-up inquiry from an attorney regarding a former employee of Jeffrey Epstein and her sister. The FBI agents note they could not find a formal complaint or FBI 302 interview form for the employee, only an Electronic Communication (EC) requesting travel authority to interview her and her sister in North Carolina in 2006. The sister's 2006 interview, conducted as part of the 'MM' case, contained allegations of inappropriate contact with Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell at a New Mexico ranch in the 1990s. The FBI concluded any victimization was likely outside the statute of limitations and directed the attorney to the official FOIA process.

persons.name: Sean
persons.context: FBI SSA from Squad C-20 (Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking) in the New York office who authored the final email in the chain, summarizing the findings and directing the inquiring attorney to the FOIA process.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of the sister's 2006 interview, where she alleged she "cuddled" with him at a ranch in New Mexico in the 1990s.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as 'Maxwell'; mentioned in the sister's 2006 interview allegation that she "rubbed her breasts during a massage" at the New Mexico ranch in the 1990s.

connections.description: Both are implicated in the same alleged incident of inappropriate contact with the witness's sister at a New Mexico ranch in the 1990s.
Sean, as an FBI SSA, is involved in the follow-up inquiry regarding allegations against Epstein.

events.title: FBI Travel Request and Interviews
events.description: An FBI Electronic Communication (EC) was created requesting travel authority for agents to go to North Carolina to interview a former Epstein employee and her sister. The sister was interviewed as part of the 'MM' case.

events.title: Alleged Incident at New Mexico Ranch
events.description: A woman (sister of the former employee) alleged that in the 1990s, she went to a ranch in New Mexico, "cuddled" with Jeffrey Epstein, and that Ghislaine Maxwell rubbed her breasts during a massage.

events.title: FBI Internal Email Follow-up
events.description: FBI agents corresponded internally about a follow-up inquiry from an attorney seeking documentation on a former Epstein employee and her sister. They reported their findings and directed the attorney to the FOIA process.

keyFacts: The FBI could not locate a formal complaint or an FBI 302 interview form for a former Epstein employee from the 1990s, only a 2006 travel request to interview her.
The employee's younger sister was interviewed by the FBI in 2006 as part of the 'MM' case and made allegations of inappropriate contact with Epstein and Maxwell at a New Mexico ranch in the 1990s.
The FBI's assessment in 2019 was that any potential victimization of these individuals was likely outside the statute of limitations, so they were not pursued further at that time.
The document reveals a specific, previously unreported alleged incident involving Maxwell directly engaging in inappropriate physical contact (rubbing breasts during a massage).
The FBI directed the inquiring attorney to the official FOIA process, indicating the records were considered part of the Miami case files.
